javaslang.control

Interface Option<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the optional value.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Functor<T>, HigherKinded<T,Option<?>>, Iterable<T>, Monad<T,Option<?>>, Serializable, ValueObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    None, Some

    public interface Option<T>
extends Monad<T,Option<?>>, ValueObject, Iterable<T>

    Replacement for Optional.

    Option is a monadic container type which represents an optional value. Instances of Option are either an instance of Some or the singleton None.

    Most of the API is taken from Optional. A similar type can be found in Haskell and Scala.
    Since:
    1.0.0

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true, if this is None, otherwise false, if this is Some.

      • isDefined

        default boolean isDefined()

        Returns true, if this is Some, otherwise false, if this is None.

        Please note that it is possible to create new Some(null), which is defined.

        Returns:
        true, if this Option has a defined value, false otherwise

      • orElse

        default T orElse(T other)

        Returns the value if this is a Some or the other value if this is a None.

        Please note, that the other value is eagerly evaluated.

        Parameters:
        other - An alternative value
        Returns:
        This value, if this Option is defined or the other value, if this Option is empty.

      • orElseGet

        default T orElseGet(Supplier<? extends T> supplier)

        Returns the value if this is a Some, otherwise the other value is returned, if this is a None.

        Please note, that the other value is lazily evaluated.

        Parameters:
        supplier - An alternative value supplier
        Returns:
        This value, if this Option is defined or the other value, if this Option is empty.

      • filter

        default Option<T> filter(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Returns Some(value) if this is a Some and the value satisfies the given predicate. Otherwise None is returned.
        Parameters:
        predicate - A predicate which is used to test an optional value
        Returns:
        Some(value) or None as specified

      • flatten

        default <U,OPTION extends HigherKinded<U,Option<?>>> Option<U> flatten(Function<? super T,? extends OPTION> f)
        Flattens an Option using a function.

        Examples: 

         
 Match<Option<U>> f
    .caze((Option<U> o) -> o)
    .caze((U u) -> new Some<>(u))
    .build();
 new Some<>(1).flatten();                    // = Some(1)
 new Some<>(new Some<>(1)).flatten(f); // = Some(1)
 new Some<>(None.instance()).flatten(f);     // = None
 new None.instance().flatten(f);                   // = None
        Specified by:
        flatten in interface Monad<T,Option<?>>
        Type Parameters:
        U - component type of the result Option
        OPTION - an Option&lt;U&gt;
        Parameters:
        f - a function which maps elements of this Option to Options
        Returns:
        a new Option

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object o)
        Description copied from interface: ValueObject
        Checks if o equals this. 
             
     if (o == this) {
         return true;
     } else if (o instanceof CurrentType) {
         final CurrentType that = (CurrentType) o;
         return ...; // check if values of this and that are pairwise equal
     } else {
         return false;
     }
        Please note that double and float values 0.0 and -0.0 are considered to be not equal when using Double.compare(double, double), just in case.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface ValueObject
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - An object, may be null.
        Returns:
        true, if o equals this, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Objects.equals(Object, Object)
